info.name: Laravel JSON:API
info.description:
# About
Laravel JSON:API is backend product built by [Creative Tim](https://www.creative-tim.com/) and [UPDIVISION](https://updivision.com/).
To find out more about the project visit our [product page](https://www.creative-tim.com/product/vue-material-dashboard-laravel-pro).

# JSON:API
JSON:API is a specification for how a client should request that resources be fetched or modified, and how a server should respond to those requests. 
It is designed to minimize both the number of requests and the amount of data transmitted between clients and servers. This efficiency is achieved without compromising readability, flexibility, or discoverability.

# Prerequisites

The Laravel JSON:API backend project requires a working Apache/Nginx local environment with PHP, Composer and MySQL.

If you don't already have a local development environment, use one of the following links:
- Windows: [How to install WAMP on Windows](https://updivision.com/blog/post/beginner-s-guide-to-setting-up-your-local-development-environment-on-windows)
- Linux: [How to install LAMP on Linux](https://howtoubuntu.org/how-to-install-lamp-on-ubuntu)
- Mac: [How to install MAMP on MAC](https://wpshout.com/quick-guides/how-to-install-mamp-on-your-mac/)
- Install Composer: [https://getcomposer.org/doc/00-intro.md](https://getcomposer.org/doc/00-intro.md)

Install Composer: https://getcomposer.org/doc/00-intro.md

# Download
For the free version of the project you can either
- download the .zip file from the Creative Tim site and extract it or
- make a clone from the Github repository
For the PRO version you will download the .zip file after you purchase the product on the [Creative Tim](https://www.creative-tim.com/) website.

Unzip the archie and you will get two project folders: one for the Laravel API project and one for the Vue frontend.

# Installation
1. Navigate in your Laravel API project folder: `cd your-laravel-json-api-project`
2. Install project dependencies: `composer install`
3. Create a new .env file: `cp .env.example .env`
3. Add your own database credentials in the .env file in DB_DATABASE, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD
5. Create users table: `php artisan migrate --seed`
6. Generate application key: `php artisan key:generate`
7. Install Laravel Passport: `php artisan passport:install`
8. Add your own mailtrap.io credentials in MAIL_USERNAME and MAIL_PASSWORD in the .env file

item.description:
### Description
Provides basic CRUD endpoints for the *Users* resource, as well as the *Upload Profile Image* which can be used for associating an avatar image to a single user.

### User Resource Attributes
- **name**: _string_
 - String representing the full name of the user.

- **email**: _string_
 - String representing the email of the user.
 - Must be formatted as a valid email address.

- **profile-image**: _string_ 
 - String representing a valid URL address at which the users profile image is located.

### User Resource Relationships
- **roles**: _HasMany_
 - The available starting roles are _Admin_, _Creator_ and _Member_.

item.name: Roles API - PRO Feature

query.description: The page number.
The number of roles per page.
Filters the collection by the specifed role name value.
Incudes the specified relations in the requested collection. Possible values: permissions.
Sorts the resource collection by the specified value. Possible values are: name, created_at.  All values can be appended with either + or - to specify the sorting order.
Only returns the specified role attributes.
Only returns the specified permissions relationship attributes.
Includes the specified relations for the requested role. Possible values: permissions .
Only returns the specified role attributes.
Only returns the specified permissions relationship attributes.

item.description:
### Description
Provides basic CRUD endpoints for the *Role* resource.

### User Resource Attributes
- **name**: _string_
 - String representing the name of the Role.

### User Resource Relationships
- **permissions**: _HasMany_

item.name: Permissions API - PRO Feature

query.description: The page number.
The number of permission per page.
Only returns the specified permissions attributes.

item.description:
### Description
Provides only a List endpoint due to the read-only nature of the permissions resource.
The available permissions are:
  - _view_ Permissions
  - _view / create / edit_ Users
  - _view / create / edit_ Roles
  - _view / create / edit / delete_ Categories
  - _view / create / edit / delete_ Tags
  - _view / create / edit / delete_ Items

### User Resource Attributes
- **name**: _string_
 - String representing the name of the Role.

item.name: Tags API - PRO Feature

query.description: The page number.
The number of tags per page.
Filters the collection by the specifed tag name value.
Filters the collection by the specifed tag color value.
Sorts the collection by the specified value. Possible values are: name, color, created_at.  All values can be prepended with either + or - to select the sorting order.
Only returns the specified tags attributes.

item.description:
### Description
Provides basic CRUD endpoints for the *Tag* resource.

### Tag Resource Attributes
- **name**: _string_
 - String representing the name of the tag.

- **color**: _string_
 - String representing the color of the tag.
 - Must be a valid color.

item.name: Categories API - PRO Feature

query.description: The page number.
The number of categories per page.
Filters the collection by the specifed category name value.
Filters the collection by the specifed category description value.
Sorts the collection by the specified value. Possible values are: name, description, created_at.  All values can be prepended with either + or - to select the sorting order.
Only returns the specified resource attributes or relationship attributes.
Only returns the specified categories attributes.

item.description:
### Description
Provides basic CRUD endpoints for the *Category* resource.

### Category Resource Attributes
- **name**: _string_
 - String representing the name of the category.

- **description**: _string_
 - String representing a short description of the category.

item.name: Items API - PRO Feature

query.description: The page number.
The number of items per page.
Filters the collection by the specifed item name value.
Filters the collection by the specifed category name value.
Filters the collection by the specifed tag name value.
Filters the collection by the specifed status value. Possible values: published, draft, archive.
Filters the collection by the specifed boolen value. Possible values: 0 (false), 1 (true).
Filters the collection by the specifed date_at value. In the case of interval filtering between the dates the first element of the date_at array will be the start of the interval.
Filters the collection by the specifed date_at value. In the case of interval filtering between the dates the second element of the date_at array will be the stop of the interval.
Filters the collection by the specifed created_at value. In the case of interval filtering between the dates the first element of the created_at array will be the start of the interval.
Filters the collection by the specifed created_at value. In the case of interval filtering between the dates the second element of the created_at array will be the stop of the interval.
Includes the specified relations in the requested collection. Possible values: user,category,tags.
Sorts the collection by the specified value. Possible values are: name,category.name,tags.name,created_at.  All values can be prepended with either + or - to select the sorting order.
Only returns the specified item attributes.
Only returns the specified user relationship attributes.
Only returns the specified tags relationship attributes.
Only returns the specified category relationship attributes.
Includes the specified relations in the requested collection. Possible values: user,user.roles,category,tags.

item.description:
### Description
Provides basic CRUD endpoints for the *Item* resource.

### Item Resource Attributes
- **name**: _string_
 - String representing the name of the item.

- **description**: _string_
 - String representing a description of the item.

- **excerpt**: _string_
 - String representing a short excerpt of the description of the item.
 
- **status**: _string_
 - String representing the status of the item.

- **image**: _string_
 - String representing a valid URL address at which the item image is located.
 
- **is_on_homepage**: _bool_
 - Boolean representing whether or not the item will be displayed on the homepage of the application.
